description: From Middle English culpable, from Old French culpable, from Latin culpabilis (“blameworthy”), from culpare (“to blame, condemn”), from culpa (“fault, crime, mistake”). Compare also culprit.

adjectives.description: culpable (comparative more culpable, superlative most culpable)

entries.meaning: Meriting condemnation, censure or blame, especially as something wrong, harmful or injurious; blameworthy, guilty.
examples: I am culpable for stealing your money.
